name: Stonroy_Soma
content:
Stonroy Soma was a human male who served as an aide in the Alderaanian delegation of the Galactic Senate of the Galactic Republic in 32 BBY. He served alongside fellow aides Liana Merian and Agrippa Aldrete, and the Senator for the planet Alderaan, Bail Antilles, during the Naboo Crisis. He at one point sat with Aldrete and Antilles in a repulsorpod in the Galactic Senate Building on the planet Coruscant. Soma had light skin and brown hair. He donned a draped overcloak of mauve fabric ornated with square motifs and golden lining, under which he wore an ankle-length white tunic.
Stonroy Soma was a character created to appear in the 1999 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace, in a scene filmed on B Stage at Leavesden Studios June 30, 1997. However, the scene he appeared in was ultimately cut from the final release. In the deleted scene, Soma sits with Merian, Aldrete, and Antilles in a repulorspod in the Senate Building while Queen Padm√© Amidala calls for a Vote of No Confidence in Supreme Chancellor Finis Valorum. Antilles, who at that time was identified as Bail Organa, then stands and seconds the motion. In the current Star Wars canon, the character was first mentioned in the 2017 reference book Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia.
